poem:
Title: A Sigh in the Midst of Conflict

In the broken orchard
Israel—a bee buzzing, and
a blossom fallen.
Orders—like stones skipped
across Gaza's bruised waters.
Palestinians, bare-root trees, 
await spring's assurance.
Cease and protect, 
chanted every fortnight,
on a stage ablaze with conflict.
23 February holds its breath,
awaiting echoes of peace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel appears to be in breach of ICJ orders on Gaza, senior UN official says Israel appears to be in breach of the orders issued a fortnight ago by the international court of justice requiring it to take immediate steps to protect Palestinians’ rights and cease all activities that could constitute genocide, the UN special rapporteur on the occupied territories, Francesca Albanese, has said. The Israeli government was given until 23 February to report to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
